Sentencas: In this study, a typical solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrode microstructure is numerically optimized in terms of the volume fraction of the catalyst, electrolyte and pore phases via a novel tool based on Dream.3D for the synthetic microstructure reconstruction and COM-SOL Multiphysics (R) Modeling for visualizing and computing three/triple phase boundaries (TPBs).
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: First, the properties of the representative volume element are studied by a parameter independence analysis based on the average particle size.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: The results indicate that the size of the representative volume element should be at least 10 times greater than the largest average particle size in the microstructure, while the number of mesh elements should be selected such that the smallest average particle size in the system is divided into at least 5.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: The method is then validated with the available studies in the literature and seems to agree well.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: Therefore, numerical reconstruction of SOFC electrodes by the pro-posed method is found to be a very useful tool in the viewpoints of accuracy, flexibility and cost.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: Finally, SOFC electrode microstructures having the same particle size distribution of an average particle size of 0.5 mm for each phase but with various phase volume fractions are generated and the resultant TPBs are computed similarly.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: It is found out that the volume fraction of each phase should be close to each other as much as possible to maximize the active TPB density and among the cases considered, the highest active TPB density of 9.53 mm/mm(3) is achieved for an SOFC electrode including 35 vol% catalyst, 35 vol % electrolyte and 30 vol% porosity.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length

Sentencas: The active TPB density is also found to be around 93% of the total TPB density.
Titulo: Engineering solid oxide fuel cell electrode microstructure by a micro-modeling tool based on estimation of TPB length
